item.title: Pickup compile error
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

One equals sign (=) is an assignment operator
Two equals signs (==) in a boolean logical operator (equal to).

You want to use two equal signs.

You can read more about Boolean logical operators here… Java Boolean Logical Operators

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup compile error
item.dc:creator: @baseball4355 baseball4355
item.description:
@baseball4355 wrote:

i am trying to make a ::pickup code where when you type in a certain id it wont give it too you and will display a message saying you cant have it. So far i have…

	[code]if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 1))
	{
		try
		{
			int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
			int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

			if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0)
			{
				addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
			}
			if (newItemID = 773)
			{
				sendMessage("You Can't Have This Item!");
			}
			else
			{
				sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
			}
		}
		catch (Exception e)
		{
			sendMessage("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! ");
		}
	}[/code]

and thought it would work but i get this error…

client.java:14233: incompatible types
found     :int
required: boolean

if (newItemID = 773)

can anyone help me out here?

Read full topic
